text: The Men's 200 metre butterfly competition at the 2019 World Championships was held on 23 and 24 July 2019.ScheduleStart list The event was won by Kristóf Milák, who broke a 10-year-old record set by Michael Phelps, and set a new world-record time of 1:50.73 in the process. ==Records== Prior to the competition, the existing world and championship records were as follows. The following new records were set during this competition. ==Results== ===Heats=== The heats were held on 23 July at 10:45.Heats results {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center" |- !
